isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - CAB TILTING PROCEDURE - CAB FRONT AND REAR MOUNT ADJUSTMENT

svcproc.title: CAB FRONT AND REAR MOUNT ADJUSTMENT

step1.para: Loosen mounting bolts at right front hinge ( Figure 17).

caution.para: Do not remove mounting bolts or damage to the cab can result during adjusting procedure.

step1.para: Raise cab and engage cab safety prop.
Loosen bolts at both rear mounting pad brackets ( Figure 19and Figure 20).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Cab Latch Mounting Pads - Left Side
Figure 20. Cab Latch Mounting Pads - Right Side

step1.para: At left pad hook bracket, set distance between centerline of left pad hook bolt and vertical side of left frame rail to 6.75 inches (171 mm).
Disengage cab prop, lower cab and again check cab alignment with chassis.
Make adjustment as required to square cab with chassis.
Tighten left pad bracket mounting bolts to 23 - 27 ft-lbs. (31 - 37 N•m) and right front hinge mounting bolts to 110 - 120 ft-lbs. (149 - 163 N•m).
Raise and lower cab and check cab alignment again.
Adjust right rear mounting pad so that latch and pad "Vs" are in line to line contact on both sides.
Tighten right rear pad mounting bolts to 23 - 27 ft-lbs. (31 - 37 N•m).
